intro: Calendula arvensis subsp. sublanata, commonly known as the woolly weed or hairy ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other calendula species, particularly in its dense pubescence and floral structure.
